data.meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.
data.sentence: The word أَرْسَلْنَا comes from the root ر س ل and is associated with the meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.

data.meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.
data.sentence: The word وَاحِدَةً comes from the root و ح د and is associated with the meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word فَكَانُوا comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
data.sentence: The word صَيْحَةً comes from the root ص ي ح and is associated with the meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
The word كَهَشِيمِ comes from the root ه ش م and is associated with the meanings: to crush/break.

data.meanings: To prevent, restrain, forbid, confine, limit, restrict, enclose.
data.sentence: The word الْمُحْتَظِرِ comes from the root ح ظ ر and is associated with the meanings: To prevent, restrain, forbid, confine, limit, restrict, enclose.
